turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Whoa...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: After the revolution, the Paris cemeteries overflowed. They dug up all the old bodies and brought them here. Seven million people. Mostly very poor.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Pretty stylish digs for a bunch of paupers.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Well, they are French.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: These tunnels must loop around and connect.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Let's go from both ends. We'll cut him off.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Okay. Be careful.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: You too.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh God. Shit...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Andy...

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Hey! You shouldn't be down there!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: FOR GOD'S SAKES, LET ME OUT!!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: GET ME THE FUCK OUT OF HERE!!

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: "Fuck"? You think I don't know this word "fuck"? Is that how you talk to policemen in America?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Okay, what the hell are you up to?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It bit me! My leg! Jesus, it's down there, shoot it! Shoot it for Christ's sakes!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: There's something down there! A bear or something! A god damn monster! Beau coup teeth! Huge, Grande, with yellow eyes, all this hair, it killed Serafine! My God...

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: You on drugs? Huh?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Pull over! Now!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: It's you. You should be dead in that wreck with Bazin and Racine!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Shhh! Be quiet, man! We're not alone -

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Shut up! Save your stories. The only thing I want to hear is you begging for your life. I want to see you suffer, like they did.  Haha! You're scared now, eh? Come on. Where's the scary monster now huh? Ha ha... We'll see who -

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: In Paris we have an expression for people like you: Encul√© d'Americain.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah? In New York we got an expression too. Goes like this...

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Where's the ADM? Where did your uncle put it?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Man, I don't know what the fuck you're talking about.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Bullshit! Your uncle told you!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: My uncle's in a coma you moron!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Before the coma!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: He didn't tell me anything. All he said was Saint Severin...

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Saint Severin? The church? So you know all about the ADM!  Where is it! Tell me! Tell me or else!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Or else what? You'll kill me?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: No. But I'll kill your fucking girlfriend!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You'll never get the chance.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Don't be an idiot! I'm not the only one. If I die, Serafine dies!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Bullshit! You're bluffing!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: What, you think Claude hangs out underground cause he likes to dance?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Claude...?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And you call me a moron...

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: The ADM. Let's go.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah, okay. Just gimme a minute to freshen up.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: So, if you and the nutty professor are both werewolves, what do you want with drugs? You like seeing lots of pretty colors when you're tearing people's throats out?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: If you know about the church, why ask such stupid questions?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: What's the problem?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hey, I'm new here, what do you want?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Do you think I'm an idiot?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Sure. Don't you?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Another step and he's dead!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Go ahead Serafine. Blow him away.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You bastard! God! I should've known. You wanted the cure all for yourself!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Cure!? Ha-ha-ha!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Ha. Some wonder drug...

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Why isn't it doing anything!?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Nothing's happening!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Looks like he lied to you too.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: You recognize her?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: We know you were with her.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh shit... No...

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: That's not all...  Marcel - Officer Boulard was following you.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh no... no....

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: He was a good man. Now his wife is a widow.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: This is... it's like a sick joke, I -

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: Merde... Wait here. When I return you tell me about last night, huh?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: But... I don't remember anything, I swear...

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: I leave these open. Maybe something comes back to you.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: I always wanted to do that. I saw it in a movie.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What about me?

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: My men think you died and floated away in the Seine. If I wanted to, I could let them believe that.  But that would be illegal...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I'm sorry my friend, I'm not signing books right now. There's been a tragedy.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I know. I'm Andy McDermott. Terrence's nephew.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: It's horrible. Terrence was one of the most brilliant men I've known.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah, well, why did he hang out here? The cops said it's dangerous -

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: The cops. It's their backward laws that force all this underground in the first place, endangering people whose only crime is pushing the limits of perception, exploring new states of psychic awareness.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Psychic awareness. Right.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You think it's silly. But do you realize that young man is actually in a deep sleep?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: He's on a new drug called ZBH, or "Daydream". It allows the user to be fully alert and mobile while he's dreaming. He is literally conscious and unconscious at the same time.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah well, that's like really groovy and everything, but who hacked my uncle's legs off?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Andy...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Terrence and I came down here to do serious work. For centuries these tunnels have been home to subcultures mainstream society would not tolerate.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You didn't know? But then why did you... well, don't worry. It's relatively mild.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah, well if I claw my face off, just pack it in ice, okay? Jesus... the cops were probably right. My uncle was messed up with a bunch of fry brains and they went berserk on him.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Not you too -

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: My God! Serafine's right. It's time to go. We'll talk soon.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You're exactly right, Andy. I enlisted both Serafine and your uncle to obtain ADM. And now I'm counting on your assistance too.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Why the fuck would I do that?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: "Simon ate of the heart of the beast and his soul was cleansed."  These pictures are not just myth, Andy. The scholars of the day used them to record facts and enlighten the public. This is the medieval version of a newspaper.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah, well what if it's the Weekly World News...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I don't believe we've been introduced.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What?... Oh, right, you can see these guys too. Jesus...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Great. Later on we'll have to get together for cocktails. Right now I kinda have to hurry before I grow a lot of hair and eat people.  Say this heart thing works. What's it got to do with ADM?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: It's chemistry, Andy. Nothing more. Mutated antigens concentrated in the heart of the infector unlock a vaccine- like chain reaction in the infectee. There were not many bio-chemists working in the twelfth century, but with today's technology it's possible to synthesize any chemical imaginable. When I discovered this ancient cure I knew who to go to.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Uncle Terrence.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yes. I was able to decode the old texts and give Terrence the specifications. It took a lot of trial and error, but finally he got it: Adenine Di-Methyloxide. ADM. I call it ADAM. But just before he was attacked, he hid it...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Because Gaston was after it.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yes, that sociopath. He's given himself over to the evil of lycanthropy. To him, ADAM is just a threat to the terror he holds over others. To us, it's salvation.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Eight o'clock. Shit. You'd think my uncle would have left a clue, a note, something...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: That's what Serafine is searching for. Without much luck, I'm afraid. If only we could speak with him. But alas, he's off in another realm, close to death.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It killed him... You coulda just used Draino. It's cheaper.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I told him it wasn't ready...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: All my life I've worked to unlock the power of the unconscious mind. Well this is it. This is power!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You sure it's not just 'coz you jerk off too much?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Uncle Terrence?

turns.speaker: TERRENCE
turns.text: Andy? Andy is that you?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah. Look, uncle Terrence -

turns.speaker: TERRENCE
turns.text: Andy, I have to tell you about the dream I had - or that I'm still having - it feels like a systemic, physio- tropic reaction to some drug, maybe a triptamine or phenethylamine derivative. But it is hyper-real. I'd swear my legs had been cut off or... wait a second... I'm getting a strange meta-physical buzz. Shit. I'm, uh, dead, aren't I?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Sort of...

turns.speaker: TERRENCE
turns.text: Undead. Right. Sort of an ectocosmic manifestation. What a pisser. Tell you one thing though, Timothy Leary will be jealous as hell.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Great, but listen, I need to know where you hid the ADM?

turns.speaker: TERRENCE
turns.text: The ADM! Be careful, Andy. It's very powerful. How do you know about it?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I went to St. Severin church.  Now look -

turns.speaker: TERRENCE
turns.text: Oh shit! No! Andy, don't let them take me back there!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: The ADM! Quickly! Where is it?!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Where is it! Please!

turns.speaker: TERRENCE
turns.text: AHHH!! The wine cellar!! In a bottle of Chateau Margaux. A metal cylinder... Don't... Don't - AAAAH!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Uncle Terrence, you're...

turns.speaker: TERRENCE
turns.text: Yeah, I finally "checked out", thank God. But there's a bit of unfinished business.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Claude.

turns.speaker: TERRENCE
turns.text: I never thought I'd ask this of anyone, Andy, but do me a favor and kill the evil son-of-a-bitch, will you?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Andrew Mc-dair-mo?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: That's McDermott, but yeah.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: He's in charge but, uh, between you and me, my English is better.  This way... So you're from New York eh? I love those Hill Street Blues...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Right. Listen, my uncle, it's not serious is it? Did he eat some bad snails? Slip on the bidet? What?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: How well did, er, do you know him?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Not too well. He taught at the Sorbonne, right? Dad always calls him his "hippie brother". Did some work with Timothy Leary I think, and - Is he... is he going to die?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: No. The doctors say the machines should keep him going a long time. But basically he is, how you say, a legume.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Legume? You mean, a vegetable?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Vegetable, right. My mistake. It seems he was attacked by a maniac, maybe two or three maniacs, just after midnight. yesterday. They fled into the tunnels beneath Paris, that's all we know...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What do you mean, maniacs?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Well, here's what I think happened. A chemistry professor goes to a bad part of town late at night. Why? Perhaps he's making a few francs on the side. The psychedelic drug market is big these days. He gets mixed up with a bad crowd and, like they say, if you lie with dogs, you get fleas.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah, well, these fleas must have teeth like fuckin' chain saws.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Maybe we should go now. You must be very tired. We'll call if any new -

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I can't believe this. Why don't you go down in the tunnels and find the goddamn... animals that attacked my uncle?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Andy, it's not so easy. There are hundreds of kilometers of tunnels under Paris. It's a whole other city, crawling with drug addicts, lunatics, skinheads... It's no man's land.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah. I guess so.  Did he say anything? Before the coma?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Just the name of this hospital, St. Severin. He repeated it a few times then he lost consciousness.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Why would he pick this one?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: I don't know. There were others much closer. He was religious?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Not that I know.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Well, when you're about to pop off, what have you got to lose? Thanks for your help.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: I'm afraid she's not so lucky. She's undead. And so am I.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Aaaaa!!! Get the fuck away from me!

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: What are you so damn angry about? Did somebody turn into a wild beast and rip your intestines out? Huh?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Fuck you! If I'm gonna kill myself I'll do it when I'm good and ready! You can go to hell!

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: No we can't. That's the problem. God knows it would beat hanging around with you!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Alright. Let me write a letter.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Good man. Now can I have my arms back?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What the hell, lots of my heroes killed themselves. Hemingway, Van Gogh... um... Herve Villachaise...

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: But this is class kid, all the way. What a way to go.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Shit. I feel sick.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Don't worry. In a few seconds you won't feel a thing.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Puking on yourself in midair is not a good death.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Yeah, well I don't know much about chemistry, but even if this stuff works, you better find it by midnight. Otherwise it's -

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah, I know. Back to the Eiffel Tower.  And what about you?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Okay. So he's weird. Maybe on drugs. Still, that's not -

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: I'm telling you. It's not drugs. It's something more. Someth -

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Don't give me your black magic bullshit! Seven mutilations in forty eight hours and all you find is a scrawny American boy? Do you have a motive?  Do you have a weapon? Or do you want me to believe he did it with his own two hands?

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: I told you. These murders are not normal.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Enough. Cut him loose.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: I can't! At midnight tonight, he will kill again. It's crazy!

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Are you crazy? We have nothing. Let him go, then watch him. If you're right, you can pick him up at midnight. Or maybe he'll lead you to the others. Just let him go.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Andy, stop! I think he can help you -

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Allo?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Andy!

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Serafine? Is that you? What's going on?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Claude, it's Andy, he's acting really weird, I think something happened last night...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: God, well don't let him go! Catch him!

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: No, it's no cure. It's something much more interesting.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: You fucking liar!

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Oh, did I hurt the little girl's feelings? Well excusez moi... I confess my desire for ADM is quite "intense". So I deceived you and our poor friend Terry - a competent technician, but let's face it, a bit naive. "The great cure for lycanthropy!" Hmph. He didn't have the vision to grasp the potential of ADAM, until it was too late. And even then, he came rushing down to tell me, as if I would be just as shocked! Ha.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: What've you got?

turns.speaker: DESK OFFICER
turns.text: Just a crazy call from a girl, probably fucked up on drugs. I wouldn't bother you but you said call with anything unusual.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: What did she say?

turns.speaker: DESK OFFICER
turns.text: Something about a monster, underground, in the catacombs under Place Denfert.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: I need two tactical assault squads at Place Denfert immediately. You can tell the commissioner it's a code red.

turns.speaker: DESK OFFICER
turns.text: But Inspector, this girl, I wouldn't call her reliable.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: Now!

turns.speaker: DESK OFFICER
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: Merde.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: He says -

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: Here.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Your uncle was carrying this. The keys to his apartment are in there. I talked to his assistant, Madame Flocquet. You'll be staying there a while?

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Okay. So maybe you were right.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: Hmmph. At least now there's one person around here who doesn't think I'm crazy.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: Twelve thirty-six a.m. here. Twelve forty a.m. here. There's two of them. At least.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Merde.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: Two more nights in this lunar cycle.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Double merde.

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: You better follow that McDermott kid. He's going to wind up like his uncle if he's not careful.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Right. Little twerp thinks he's Colombo.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Saint Severin...

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: You never heard the story of Saint Severin driving the werewolves from Paris?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: You think that's what McDermott was raving about in the ambulance?

turns.speaker: LEDUC
turns.text: What, you think everyone's as ignorant as you?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Why were you so late tonight

turns.speaker: ANASTASIA
turns.text: I was showing Sonya something . . .

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What were you showing her?

turns.speaker: ANASTASIA
turns.text: How to read.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: I thought you were told not to tutor your servants anymore.

turns.speaker: ANASTASIA
turns.text: I know, but I had to because . . .

turns.speaker: ANASTASIA
turns.text: Oh, Grandmama, why do you have to go back to Paris?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: It's where I've made my home but I do have something for you . . .

turns.speaker: ANASTASIA
turns.text: "Together in Paris"! Oh, when can we be "together in Paris?!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: When you're older . . .

turns.speaker: ANASTASIA
turns.text: Hurry, Grandmama!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Get on! Anastasia, get on!

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: Are you running away?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: No.  I'm running <u>to</u>.

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: Where is your home, Anya?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I'm not sure but look. . .

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I have to go now, before it gets light.

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: But what if we can't ever find where we came from?!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Then you'll have to make your own home. Lots of people do.

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: Anya! What if <u>we</u> can't find anyone who loves us?!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Then come find me.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Who did you hear it from?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I heard it from everyone who said I didn't hear it from them!   Do you know Dmitri?

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Providing travel papers is illeagal!  I know Dmitri well - perhaps I can help you.  Providded you have enough money to pay for this service. . .

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Well, I don't have any money . . .

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Good day!

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: I was just wondering since we already have the dress. . .

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Look, I came here to get papers to travel to Paris and. . .

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Noooo....

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: She's quite right, Dmitri, a man of my stature should not have to

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Is everyone all right?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: We have to prepare you for an audience with Sophie.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Who's Sophie?

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Ah ... the Lady Sophie... The ravishing first cousin, once removed, from the Empress. We must convince Sophie that you are the Princess before we'll be granted a meeting with the Empress ... your grandmother, I mean.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: We're just going to refresh your memory...

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I don't have a memory and I'm not a Princess!  Even if I were - no one's ever going to believe it. I'm not exactly...

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Did I tell you that?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: You must have.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: No! I look ridiculous!

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Come out! I can do alterations.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: You'll laugh.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: I shant!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Not you. Him.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Oh, Meetoo! You look miserable! Oh, Vlad - look at him!

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Yes, your highness.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Poor Meetoo!

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Yes, your highness.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Cut it out, Vlad! I'm not angry with you anymore - I know how much you needed the money.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Fortunately, I am to be married.  With your highness, permission.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Vlad, stop acting this way! You're my friend!

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: No. From now on I am your loyal subject ... your highness. By your leave?

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Ouch!  That really hurt!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I'm sorry. . .  I'm. . .

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: That's quite a hard head you've got there, boy.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: AND A SONG SOMEONE SINGS ONCE UPON A DECEMBER.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Who are you?!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: People say Anastasia was the only member of the Royal Family to escape alive.  That makes her an orphan too

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: What happened to your parents?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I don't know - I don't remember anything that happened before the revolution. . .

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: You know, it's strange - Anastasia's grandmother, the Dowager Empress Tatiana has been looking for Anastasia since the revolution.  Why do you think she wouldn't go to her own grandmother?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I don't know.  I don't see what this has to do with me.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Perhaps it's because she has amnesia too - can't remember. . .

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Why do you want to go to Paris?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I have my reasons.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Anastasia's grandmother is in Paris.  We're going to bring Anastasia to her - in Paris.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: You never thought of the possibility?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Look - there isn't an orphan in the world who doesn't dream she's a princess but, come on. . .  Look at me!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Do you always punch people first thing in the morning?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Sorry - it's a reflex. Living in an orphanage if someone bothers you - you automatically come up swinging.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: I wasn't bothering you. I was trying to wake you up!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: By pulling my hair?!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: I was all out of dynamite!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I'm going to stretch my legs

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: That's a good idea - a great idea - stretch your legs  ... stretch then that way.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Come on up!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Just what do you think you're doing?!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Trying... to... breathe...
